definition:
An *entire function* is a function
$f: \mathbb{C} \longrightarrow \mathbb{C}$ which is holomorphic
everywhere on the complex domain $\mathbb{C}$.

For example, a polynomial is holomorphic everywhere, as is the
exponential function. The function $z\mapsto 1/z$ is not holomorphic at
zero, so it is not entire; it is meromorphic.
